oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1941-10-04 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 4, 1941. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Rachel Veach, Alcyone Bate Beasley and her trio (of Jack Shook, Napoleon 'Nap' Bastien, and Dee Simmons), Paul Warmack and his Gully Jumpers, Ford Rush, Mac McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers, and Pap & Odie (likely Lonnie Wilson and Curly Rhodes respectively). Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pap & Odie; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Mac McGar; Tennessee Mountaineers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: George D. Hay introduces Pap & Odie -- Oh Monah (Pap & Odie) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay, Roy Acuff, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- How Beautiful Heaven Must Be (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay talks -- How Beautiful Heaven Must Be (reprise) (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Louie Buck talks -- George D. Hay introduces Mack McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers --Ragtime Annie (Mack McGar and his Tennessee Mountaineers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Louie Buck, George D. Hay, Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Pap & Odie; Wilson, Lonnie; Rhodes, Curly; McGar, Mac; Tennessee Mountaineers (Musical group : Mac McGar); Gully Jumpers (Paul Warmack); Warmack, Paul; Beasley, Alcyone; Shook, Jack; Bastien, Napoleon; Simmons, Dee (Musician)
